bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Speculation and Vacancy Tax Act;
average monthly rent, in relation to a class of apartments for a calendar year, means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the average monthly rent reported by CMHC for the calendar year for the class of apartments, or

if the average monthly rent for the class of apartments is not reported by CMHC for the calendar year, the average monthly rent reported by CMHC for the class of apartments for the first calendar year preceding that calendar year;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: CMHC means the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation established by section 3 of the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Land and improvements that are not residential property
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (f) of the definition of "residential property" in section 1 of the Act, the following land and improvements are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a parcel of land, together with improvements, if one of the improvements is a building that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is primarily used for the purpose of providing rental accommodation on a monthly or longer basis,
does not consist of strata lots, and
consists of at least 4 apartments that are only rented or offered for rent on a monthly or longer basis;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a parcel of land and any improvements on that land if any portion of the land or improvements, or both, are used in conjunction with property described in paragraph (a);

a parcel of land and any improvements on that land if any portion of the land or improvements, or both, are used as, or in conjunction with, a nursing home, rest home, bunkhouse or cookhouse referred to in section 1 (1) (a) of the Prescribed Classes of Property Regulation, B.C. Reg. 438/81;
a parcel of land and any improvements on that land if any portion of the land or improvements, or both, are used as, or in conjunction with, a group home.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (k) of the definition of "specified area" in section 1 of the Act, the following areas are prescribed:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: The Corporation of the City of Duncan;
The Corporation of the District of North Cowichan;

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Amounts that are excluded for the purposes of the definition of "unreported income"
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 5 (2) [meaning of "untaxed worldwide earner"] of the Act, money or a right or thing is prescribed for a calendar year if the money, right or thing is described in section 81 of the federal Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exempt uses of residential property owned by not-for-profit corporations
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 21 (b) [exemption for not-for-profit corporations] of the Act, a residential property must be primarily used for a charitable purpose.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Determination of annual fair market rent

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 39 (2) (c) (ii) and (3) (c) (ii) [tenancy exemption for other owners] of the Act, the fair market rent for a residential property for a calendar year is the total of the fair market rent, for the calendar year, for each residence that is part of the residential property.
The fair market rent for a residence for a calendar year is one of the following, as applicable:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a residence that is described in paragraph (a) of the definition of "residence" in section 1 of the Act or that is a townhouse or an apartment making up one half of a duplex, the amount that is twice the amount that is obtained by multiplying 12 by the average monthly rent, for the class of apartments comparable to the residence, for the calendar year;

in the case of a residence other than a residence referred to in paragraph (a), the amount that is obtained by multiplying 12 by the average monthly rent, for the class of apartments comparable to the residence, for the calendar year.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (2) (a) or (b), as applicable, a class of apartments is comparable to a residence if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: all of the apartments in the class have the same number of bedrooms as the residence or, in the case of a residence with 3 or more bedrooms, all of the apartments in the class have 3 or more bedrooms, and
all of the apartments in the class are located in the smallest geographic area in which the residence is located and for which CMHC has reported the average monthly rent for that class of apartments.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Interest payable on amounts due to the government under the Act must be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: calculated at the rate prescribed under the Interest Rate under Various Statutes Regulation, B.C. Reg. 386/92, and
calculated on a daily basis and compounded monthly.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The form set out in the Schedule is prescribed for the purposes of section 114 (2) (a) [lien] of the Act.
Section 8 of the Financial Administration Act is prescribed for the purposes of section 120 (5) (j) [communication of information] of the Act.
